title: Mathematical Thinking and Expression – Exploring, Processing, and Problem-Solving
subject: Learning Standards for Early Childhood (2024-)

document.title: Pennsylvania Learning Standards for Early Childhood PRE-KINDERGARTEN

0AD2B0534E5042F69CCB97C5725E2B3B.description: Talk and listen to peers during activities that include measuring, representing, organizing, and understanding data .

7AEA857C12D544D699882EB76D501DA5.description: When prompted, communicate thinking while engaged in activities that include measuring, representing, organizing, and understanding data .

FB804FFE5FB4480AAF17C6EB8DFE49D0.description: Problem-solve in activities that include measuring, representing, organizing, and understanding data (Reference AL.4 PK.C).

7E79F25233DF40AB8ABC65A91CE58AF1.description: Persist in activities that include measuring, representing, organizing, and understanding data (Reference AL.2 PK.C).

9F5D44D5BAC14F858CCE1D52098F8541.description: Engage in activities that include measuring, representing, organizing, and understanding data .

00625CD020EF4E4D8137373D67DC5406.description: Use mathematical processes when measuring; representing, organizing, and understanding data.

0ABAF0393FA7427FBA030B9393BA6783.description: Count and compare the quantities of each category to describe which category has “more of”/“less of” the attribute .

7E5A3D8BB2DE4D2493CEB4EDD565DD75.description: Display the number of objects in each category .

F74D24A4850641A0B98A1E12C5417978.description: Classify up to 10 objects using one attribute into categories .

ADE3E738CEEE48AE82B8628F64D39874.description: Classify objects and count the number of objects in each category.

9B4EC2D49E6046288071E29F78301C10.description: Compare two objects with a measureable attribute in common to see which object has “more of”/“less of” the attribute and describe the difference .

A6DA427DE5C3410C965C133866A2B461.description: Use ordinal number words to describe the position of objects (first, second, last) .

6DAD0D7EAE8F4DA6BBE973AFAB5F9F08.description: Sort and order by one attribute .

50089E8DA5AC4EC689B47037755E12B0.description: Practice use of standard measurement tools .

4B8F37F861F742FEA75B4EAF2170C21A.description: Measure objects using non-standard items (e .g ., hands, shoes, yarn, blocks) .

39985C39046B440E8B53A383FC6C25B8.description: Recognize attributes of objects that can be measured .

1B6B93CFF2494B898088384DC1583FEA.description:
Describe and compare measurable attributes of length and weights of
everyday objects.

60458BDCBDC04B4CB08C3C54DAAF5AEC.description: Talk and listen to peers during geometric play

BBEA7EC0E3244A00B870DABD21E346E3.description: When prompted, communicate thinking while engaged in geometric play .

05A41A20E0804C8692AE1B6DCA20C468.description: Problem-solve during geometric play (Reference AL.4 PK.C).

24F4E818816E41228CF5CA7CDC244577.description: Persist in geometric play (Reference AL.2 PK.C).

B451F7DF3FA44889B119175DD10EA04E.description:
Use mathematical processes
when drawing, constructing, modeling, and representing shapes.

EC0AAECF65F241C6947A3B088FBDEA64.description: Use simple shapes to compose larger shapes .

A3071A837C09453B824D3581B9B9EE49.description: Use geoboards to create shapes with rubber bands .

435511859E2842538FB1462D6648560A.description: Model shapes in the world by building shapes from components and drawing shapes .

039E43BD68474985A8F24F9166B42BDB.description: Analyze and compare two- and three- dimensional shapes, in different sizes and orientations, using informal language to describe their similarities, differences, parts, and other attributes .

240AAB961453421EB948215C06457FF7.description: Analyze, compare, create, and compose shapes.

4EA2C0C3EF7E4A3C9CE0E1BFDF521554.description: Identify shapes as two-dimensional (lying in a plane, “flat”) or three- dimensional (solid) .

3CCF161E14F847B7A5B77CE589EB7021.description: Describe the relative positions of objects using terms such as above, below, beside, in front of, behind, and next to .

10D170683D9F42E49729995F82B95076.description: Recognize and describe the attributes of geometric figures .

282BAC9236AE4235AABB844DEFABB6F1.description: Describe objects in the environment using names of shapes .

B160CFC023F64AD18ADF79C562D10580.description: Use common forms of numerical representation (e .g ., fingers, tally marks, dots) .

9223A14F062D478FA818B4AE3F3DB134.description: Talk and listen to peers during mathematical play .

ADDC781E02CD4485B95C096F647FFB38.description: When prompted, communicate thinking while engaged in mathematical play .

24C56CBBAB394BA984BF66F7854A8D73.description: Problem-solve during mathematical play (Reference AL.4 PK.C).

E85B67485AED45519B7BF203014C1FDF.description: Persist in mathematical play (Reference AL.2 PK.C).

DEFBB79101C24A4EAEA2822B1488D751.description: Use mathematical processes when representing relationships.

B4C619F77EF94939A58F777C7AA03254.description: Add objects to a set and tell a number story about it .

234ACBDE6F064A9FAEFFC160C904128D.description: Explain adding and subtracting sets of objects up to and including six, using basic math vocabulary (e .g ., putting together, adding to, taking away, taking apart, taking from) .

52A642C749B04B12B890FE27BFA60BF9.description: Represent addition and subtraction with objects, fingers, mental images, drawings, sounds (e .g ., claps), acting out situations, verbal explanations, expressions, or equations .

42FA34854F2847F38D1485860B0D6169.description: Understand addition as putting together and adding to, and understand subtraction as taking apart and taking from.

F3B27815810241829CBDC1AADBA9376A.description: Use common forms of numerical representation (e .g ., fingers, tally marks, dots) .

5247A146390947C9B02B8F16921A926B.description: Talk and listen to peers during numerical play .

71C2E1A1A7AA4EE9A3EB3C62B97FC86A.description: When prompted, communicate thinking while engaged in numerical play .

FE0EA23518524F8983966B5E20FF35F7.description: Persist in numerical play (Reference AL.2 PK.C).

A57ACD483FC7404E8BE534EA59F9FFAC.description: Use mathematical processes when quantifying, comparing, representing, and modeling numbers.

7A3F62C8C52D42D39CC925833438F682.description: Practice use of mathematical vocabulary to compare numbers of objects

B76111CBCF2947FF9DE8292EC02EDEAF.description: Compare two numbers between 1 and 5 when presented as written numerals .

1DECDDDA1A4846C09992B9AE3A3E5E46.description: Identify whether the number of objects in one group is greater than, less than, or equal to the number of objects in another group up to 10 .

4113D2C8A3D24552AB3D8BA76D13A6EC.description: Create sets of objects with same and different amounts .

2E63F633AA484B98AAC3DA633C6AD334.description: Use counting and numbers as part of play and as a means for determining quantity .

E98D65E4936145BC8C0D6AF9C7002E85.description: State the total number of objects counted, demonstrating understanding that the last number named tells the number of objects counted .

A5939FB566B74612B4A4C8F529658A5A.description: Use one-to-one correspondence when counting to 10 .

2563F1DA68A043B3855A669B88C907CE.description: Subitize (visually quantify) to determine how many: attach a numerical value to a set of objects without counting up to six .

617CBAFCC96544DFB03C45D51C02150D.description: Count to tell the number of objects.

22781F26DE864BC0B8A3237E420A47FE.description: Counts on when a specific number is provided .

2E8218DA54D54C98A84E31C630312163.description: Represent a number of objects with a written numeral 0–10 .

A21FB19CDAC44379A122489A67BCD9A7.description: Match a numeral to a set of 0–10 objects .

50CB26664C2F41948D77667088785FA0.description: Know number names and the count sequence.
